greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Consider the k-th row of triangle A170899 starting at the 3 in the middle of the row; the row from that point on converges to this sequence as k increases.
comment: It would be nice to have a formula or recurrence for any of A170899, A342272-A342278, or any nontrivial relation between them. This might help to understand the fractal structure of the mysterious hexagonal Ulam-Warburton cellular automaton A151723.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..255
example: Row k=6 of A170899 breaks up naturally into 7 pieces:
The last piece already matches the sequence for 16 terms. The number of matching terms doubles at each row.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 13 2021
